text: Karelichy Coat of Arms Karelichy (; , ; ; ; , Korelitz) is a town in the Grodno Region of Belarus, the administaritv centre of Karelichy District. The town was historically a center of a large Jewish community; its population in 1900 was 1,840.JewishGen.org == People from Karelichy == * Ignacy Domeyko (from Niedźwiadka village in Karelichy district) * Itzhak Katzenelson * Karelitz family, Avraham Yeshayahu Karelitz, Nissim Karelitz * Saul Adler == See also == * Mir Castle Complex * Mir, Belarus == References == ==External links== * Photos on Radzima.org Category:Urban-type settlements in Belarus Category:Populated places in Grodno Region Category:Karelichy District Category:Nowogródek Voivodeship (1507–1795) Category:Novogrudsky Uyezd Category:Nowogródek Voivodeship (1919–1939) Category:Shtetls
title: Karelichy
